oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shackled! In a Fight for Survival!, between 1961 and 1975
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An original political cartoon created by Jack Knox, the Nashville Banner editorial cartoonist, during the Vietnam War (1961-1975). This is a caricature of U. S. Vietnam commitments, as shown in the image of a small tattered flag and a man's shackled arms bound by a chain. On the chain is written "bombing restraints," "limited political objectives," and "no 'hot' pursuit of the enemy." Forms part of the Jack Knox Political Cartoons collection. 1 cartoon : b & w ; 15 x 19 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Banner
